com.apriori.reflect

Class Annotations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.apriori.reflect.Annotations

  • public final class Annotations
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for working with instances of Annotation. These are mostly helpful in fabricating annotation instances and performing comparisons between two annotations.

    • Method Detail

      • findAnnotation

        public static <A extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> A findAnnotation(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                                           java.lang.Class<A> annotationType)
        Returns an annotation, possibly searching for the annotation on super-types if not declared on the specified type. This will find annotations on super-types even if they aren't inheritable.

        If the annotation is not found on the specified type then the type's super-classes are searched for the annotation. If the annotation is still not found, then implemented interfaces are searched. Interfaces declared on the specified type are preferred over their super-interfaces. Furthermore, interfaces implemented directly by the specified type (both declared interfaces and their super-interfaces) are preferred over "inherited interfaces", which are those declared on super-types. Finally, interfaces earlier in the declaration order are preferred over those later in the implements declaration. Similarly, super-interfaces earlier in the declaration order are preferred over ones later in the extends declaration.

        Parameters:
        clazz - the type from which the annotation is queried
        annotationType - the annotaition type to find
        Returns:
        the annotation, possibly on a super-type, or null if not found

      • create

        public static <T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> T create(java.lang.Class<T> annotationType,
                                                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> attributes)
        Creates an annotation instance. Any values that are not specified will return their default value as defined in the annotation interface. The values are specified using the annotation method names as keys. The values in the map are the values to be returned by the annotation method. Annotation methods that return other annotations can be represented in the map by sub-map values (which will, in turn, be used to create the other annotations).
        Parameters:
        annotationType - the type of annotation to create
        attributes - a map of values that are returned by the annotations methods
        Returns:
        an annotation
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either argument is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the map contains a value of the wrong type (includes null values and values whose type does not match the expected return type of the corresponding method), if the map is missing a required value (a required value is one that has no default value defined on the annotation), or if the map has unrecognized keys

      • toMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> toMap(java.lang.annotation.Annotation annotation)
        Returns a map of values that correspond to the annotation's methods. If the given annotation has any fields that are nested annotations or arrays of annotations, their values in the returned map will be recursively converted to maps. Arrays will be converted to lists so that creating maps from two equal annotations will result in equal maps (array values in the map prevent this since arrays don't have a sane equals implementation).
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation
        Returns:
        a map of values where keys are the annotation method names and values are the values returned by those methods (methods that return other annotations will result in map values that are sub-maps, constructed from the other annotation using this same method)

      • toMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> toMap(java.lang.annotation.Annotation annotation,
                                                                     boolean includeAnnotationType)
        Returns a map of values that correspond to the annotation's methods, optionally including the Annotation.annotationType(). If the given annotation has any fields that are nested annotations or arrays of annotations, their values in the returned map will be recursively converted to maps. Arrays will be converted to lists so that creating maps from two equal annotations will result in equal maps (array values in the map prevent this since arrays don't have a sane equals implementation).
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation
        Returns:
        a map of values where keys are the annotation method names and values are the values returned by those methods (methods that return other annotations will result in map values that are sub-maps, constructed from the other annotation using this same method)

      • toMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> toMap(java.lang.annotation.Annotation annotation,
                                                                     java.util.function.Predicate<? super java.lang.reflect.Method> filterAttributes)
        Returns a map of values that correspond to the annotation's methods that match the specified predicate. If the given annotation has any fields that are nested annotations or arrays of annotations, their values in the returned map will be recursively converted to maps. Arrays will be converted to lists so that creating maps from two equal annotations will result in equal maps (array values in the map prevent this since arrays don't have a sane equals implementation).
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation
        filterAttributes - a predicate, for filtering the annotation's methods
        Returns:
        a map of values where keys are the annotation method names and values are the values returned by those methods, filtered according to the specified predicate

      • toMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> toMap(java.lang.annotation.Annotation annotation,
                                                                     boolean includeAnnotationType,
                                                                     java.util.function.Predicate<? super java.lang.reflect.Method> filterAttributes)
        Returns a map of values that correspond to the annotation's methods that match the specified predicate, optionally including the Annotation.annotationType(). If the given annotation has any fields that are nested annotations or arrays of annotations, their values in the returned map will be recursively converted to maps. Arrays will be converted to lists so that creating maps from two equal annotations will result in equal maps (array values in the map prevent this since arrays don't have a sane equals implementation).
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation
        includeAnnotationType - if true, the map will have a key named "annotationType" whose value is the class token returned from calling annotation.annotationType()
        filterAttributes - a predicate, for filtering the annotation's methods
        Returns:
        a map of values where keys are the annotation method names and values are the values returned by those methods, filtered according to the specified predicate

      • equal

        public static <T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> boolean equal(T annotation,
                                                                        java.lang.Object other)
        Determines if two annotation objects are equal according to the contract defined on Annotation. This is useful for creating proxies that implement annotation interfaces so as to completely adhere to the annotation spec.
        Parameters:
        annotation - an annotation
        other - another object to which the annotation is compared
        Returns:
        true if the other object has the same annotation type and returns equal values from the various annotation attributes
        See Also:
        Annotation.equals(Object)

      • equal

        public static <T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> boolean equal(T annotation,
                                                                        java.lang.Object other,
                                                                        java.util.function.Predicate<? super java.lang.reflect.Method> filterAttributes)
        Determines if two annotation objects are equal, only considering attributes that match the specified predicate. This implements the logic defined in the contract for equals defined on Annotation, except that it only compares methods that match the specified predicate. This is useful for determining similarity between two annotations where not all annotation attributes are important.
        Parameters:
        annotation - an annotation
        other - another object to which the annotation is compared
        filterAttributes - a predicate, for filtering the annotation's methods
        Returns:
        true if the other object has the same annotation type and returns equal values from the annotation attributes that match the predicate

      • hashCode

        public static <T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> int hashCode(T annotation)
        Computes the hash code for an annotation as defined in the contract on Annotation. This is useful for creating proxies that implement annotation interfaces so as to completely adhere to the annotation spec.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation
        Returns:
        the annotation's hash code

      • hashCode

        public static <T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> int hashCode(T annotation,
                                                                       java.util.function.Predicate<? super java.lang.reflect.Method> filterAttributes)
        Computes the hash code for an annotation, only considering attributes that match the specified predicate. This implements the logic defined in the contract for hash code defined on Annotation, except that it only includes methods that match the specified predicate as part of the computation.
        Parameters:
        annotation - an annotation
        filterAttributes - a predicate, for filtering the annotation's methods
        Returns:
        the annotation's hash code, computed based only on attributes that match the predicate

      • toString

        public static <T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> java.lang.String toString(T annotation)
        Returns a string representation of the specified annotation object. The string will be in the form:
          @package.Class(attribute1 = attribute1 value, attribute2 = attribute2 value)
        The values come from the string representation of annotation attribute values.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation
        Returns:
        a string representation of the annotation

      • toString

        public static <T extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> java.lang.String toString(T annotation,
                                                                                    java.util.function.Predicate<? super java.lang.reflect.Method> filterAttributes)
        Returns a string representation of the annotation, with only the attributes that match the specified predicate. The string representation is in the same form as toString(Annotation) but it only includes annotation attributes that match the specified predicate.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation
        filterAttributes - a predicate, for filtering the annotation's methods
        Returns:
        a string representation of the annotation with only the attributes that match the predicate
